description: Manage authentication of an ExpressRoute circuit.

commands.name: az network express-route auth create
commands.summary: Create a new link authorization for an ExpressRoute circuit.
commands.syntax:
az network express-route auth create --circuit-name
                                     --name
                                     --resource-group
                                     [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az network express-route auth create --circuit-name MyCircuit -g MyResourceGroup -n MyAuthorization

commands.name: az network express-route auth delete
commands.summary: Delete a link authorization of an ExpressRoute circuit.
commands.syntax:
az network express-route auth delete [--circuit-name]
                                     [--ids]
                                     [--name]
                                     [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--resource-group]
                                     [--subscription]
examples: az network express-route auth delete --circuit-name MyCircuit -g MyResourceGroup -n MyAuthorization

commands.name: az network express-route auth list
commands.summary: List link authorizations of an ExpressRoute circuit.
examples: az network express-route auth list -g MyResourceGroup --circuit-name MyCircuit
az network express-route auth list --circuit-name MyCircuit --resource-group MyResourceGroup --subscription MySubscription

commands.name: az network express-route auth show
commands.summary: Get the details of a link authorization of an ExpressRoute circuit.
examples: az network express-route auth show -g MyResourceGroup --circuit-name MyCircuit -n MyAuthorization

commands.name: az network express-route auth wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
